problem.markdown:
Here is a starting point for you: Design a simply-supported beam with a span of 10m that supports a distributed load of 50kN/m.
>>Where along the length of the beam is the shear force the greatest? << (x) At the supports ( ) At the quarter point ( ) At the midspan ( ) None of the above
[explanation] The shear force is greatest at the supports because the reaction forces cause a jump in the force that the beam must resist. [explanation]
